entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 10:45PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW FOLLOWED BY RAIN, POTENTIALLY HEAVY MID-WEEK... A round of light snowfall is likely midweek, starting as early as Tuesday afternoon. First a drop in temperatures is expected through Tuesday morning across the Panhandle. Snowfall of 2 to 4 inches is expected before a transition to rain Wednesday morning. entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels

entry.summary: ...Very Cold Over Interior Alaska Early This Week... entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph expected. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Tuesday.
